More at {{l|en|beer}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/biːɐ̯/}} * {{rhymes|de|iːɐ̯}} * {{audio|de|De-Bier.ogg|audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n||gen2=Bieres|Biere|pl2=Bier|Bierchen}} # {{lb|de|beverage}} [[beer]] {{gloss|alcoholic drink fermented from starch material; a serving of this beverage}} # {{lb|de|informal}} [[business]], [[beeswax]] {{gloss|personal affairs}} ====Usage notes==== * As is common with beverages in German, the unchanged plural ''Bier'' can be used after numerals in the sense of “quantities of beer” (glasses, bottles, cans). One may order: ''„Zwei '''Bier''', bitte!“'' – “Two '''beers''', please!” (Nota bene: In many places of the German language area, this is not a common order; instead one needs to specify {{m|de|Pils}}, {{m|de|Weißbier}}, {{m|de|Kölsch}}, etc.) * The marked plural ''Biere'' is used to mean different kinds of beer. For example: ''„Pils und Kölsch sind beliebte deutsche '''Biere'''.“'' – “Pils and Kölsch are popular German '''beers'''.” ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|(e)s|e}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de|Altbier|Bierabend|Bierbaß|Bierbecher|Bierbrauer|Biergarten|Bierhefe|Bierjunge|Bierkeller|Bierleiche|Bierschaum|Dunkelbier|Hellbier|Rauchbier|Roggenbier|Schwarzbier|Weißbier|Weizenbier}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|bor=1|it|birra}} {{see desc}} * {{desc|bor=1|ro|bere}} * {{desc|bor=1|sv|bir}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Canoo}} * {{R:Duden}} * {{R:DWDS}} * {{R:Pons}} {{topics|de|Alcoholic beverages|Beer}} ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/biːʀ/|[ˈbiː.ɐ]|[biə̯]}} * {{rhymes|lb|iːə}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|lb|gem-pro|*berô}}.
